diff_hunk:
@@ -30,9 +30,10 @@ def backward(self, reward):
         output_probs = probs.gather(1, samples)
         output_probs.add_(1e-6).reciprocal_()
         output_probs.neg_().mul_(reward)
-        # TODO: add batched index_add

body:
No, the advanced indexing only takes the last element to be assigned, and do not sum them.
I thought about this during the advanced indexing PR, but I decided to not comment on that as pytorch has the same behaviour as numpy.
